column4: Hi.  I'm used to Hardy 8.04.  I'm looking at, uhh,... (how do I know what version of Ubuntu I'm running?) Jaunty 9.04, I think.  How come the /etc/udev/rules.d directory is almost empty?  Is it supposed to be that way?  Is that info somewhere else now?  THere are about 30 files in my 8.04 installation,.
I'm trying to modify the permissions files to get my Brother scanner working, and the permissions files doesn't even exist.
Thank you.  Confirmed that I am running 9.04.  Where did the /etc/udev files go?
